thread.title: Oppo Neo 7 Tipped with 5-inch display on Company site
thread.title_full: Oppo Neo 7 Tipped with 5-inch display on Company site

title: Oppo Neo 7 Tipped with 5-inch display on Company site
text: Oppo Neo 7 Tipped with 5-inch display on Company site 26th, Oct 2015 4:00 PM View: 12 0 Oppo, after unveiling various flagship series devices has now come up with a new Neo series smartphone called Neo 7 . The device has been listed officially on the company site. More details with the pricing and availability are yet to be disclosed in the coming days. The 4G LTE band supportive phone has been listed with an Indian version on the company site for official availability.The smartphone runs on Android 5.1 Lollipop version with custom ColorOS 2.1 skin on top. It has 5-inch qHD (540*960 pixels) TFT display. It is powered up with quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 (MSM8916) processor clocked at 1.2GHz coupled with Adreno 306 and 1GB of RAM. Under the hoods, it has 16GB inbuilt storage that is expandable to 128GB via microSD card. The smartphone sports 8-megapixel rear camera with flash and comes with 5-megapixel front-facing camera. The dual-SIM cards supportive phone comes with one Micro-SIM and another Nano-SIM port. The connectivity options to explore include Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Bluetooth 4.0, Micro-USB, 3G and GPS. It measures 142.7*71.7*7.55mm and weighs 141 grams and packs a 2420mAh non-removable battery. The device has two color variants as Black and White. It also has an add-on called light-sensitive sensor that can adjust the screen brightness according to available light. Last week launch of Oppo R7s smartphone has also been recalled which has 4G dual-SIM supportive panel. It features 5.5-inch full-HD (1080x1920 pixels) Amoled display with Corning Gorilla Glass 3. further providing, 4GB RAM along with octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 (MSM8939) processor and Adreno 405 GPU, makes the device comparable in the market. It has a hybrid SIM slot that supports a Micro-SIM and a Nano-SIM card. More such specifications lined up with the device to feature a flagship series portfolio.
